article.Heading: Ease of Doing Business
article.Summary: India's rank in World Bank's "Ease of Doing Business" is far from satisfactory at 130 out of 189 countries.
article.Body:
It might have climbed a few more positions in the past few months, but India's rank in World Bank's  "Ease of Doing Business" is far from satisfactory at 130 out of 189 countries.

While the government has made tall promises of ranking among top 50 by 2017, there's a lot of action that needs to seen on the grassroot level before this promise can see light of the day. A multi-party Parliamentary report too has highlighted that despite its policy measures, things are yet to change on the ground.

The panel has observed that there's an urgent need to bridge the gap between the reforms on paper and its implementation. In his first full-fledged Union Budget (2015-16), Finance Minister Arun Jaitley had focused a lot on ease of doing business (when India ranked 142), and the upcoming Budget is likely to see the same repeat as he has said the government will make the ease of doing business and the passage of  Goods and Services Tax (GST) its top priorities.
